clinical_study.brief_title: Resolvin D1 as Biomarker of Probiotics Efficacy in IBS-C
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of a Mixture of Probiotics (Lactibiane Reference) in Patients With Irritable Bowel Syndrome Predominantly Constipation and Assessment of a Potential Biomarker (Resolvin D1): an Exploratory Study

brief_summary.textblock: Probiotics efficacy is mainly assessed by subjective endpoints such as the FDA responder rate or global relief, which partly explain contradictory results obtained in clinical trials with probiotic bacteria. Objective biomarkers of IBS will allow to measure the efficacy of probiotics. In the case of IBS-C, serum resolvin-D1 appears to be an interesting candidate due to its non-invasive and discriminating character compared to a healthy population. It is, inversely correlated with the severity of symptoms. Resolvin-D1 modulates the duration and intensity of inflammation by regulating the transcription of cytokines, chemokines and their receptors as well as other proteins involved in inflammation. Resolvin D1 could serve as a predictor of probiotic response based on its baseline value.

detailed_description.textblock:
Resolvin D1 levels will be measured in patients with IBS-C as defined by the Rome IV criteria before 6 and 12 weeks after supplementation with a mixture of probiotics. The progression of IBS-C symptoms will also be assessed throughout the study.
The correlation with resolvin D1 levels and the severity of IBS symptoms will be investigated. The efficacy of the probiotic mixture in relieving the symptoms of IBS-C will be measured and compared based on the levels of resolvin D1.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Quasi-experimental study: post-treatment versus baseline comparison

primary_outcome.measure: Change of the severity of IBS-C symptoms
primary_outcome.description: Measured by the composite IBS-SSS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome-Severity Scale Scoring) system, compared to the baseline IBS-SSS value. Minimum : 0 (best condition) to maximum (worse condition): 500

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of the severity of addominal pain
secondary_outcome.description: Mesured by the Abdominal pain domain of the IBS-SSS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome-Severity Scale Scoring) score compared to the baseline. Minimum (best condition) : 0 to maximum (worse condition): 100

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of the number of days with abdominal pain
secondary_outcome.description: Mesured by the Number of days with abdominal pain domain of the IBS-SSS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome-Severity Scale Scoring) score compared to the baseline. Minimum (best condition) : 0 to maximum (worse condition): 100

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of the severity of abdominal distension (bloating)
secondary_outcome.description: Mesured by the bloating-distension domain of the IBS-SSS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome-Severity Scale Scoring) score compared to the baseline. Minimum (best condition) : 0 to maximum (worse condition): 100

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of the satisfaction with bowel habits
secondary_outcome.description: Mesured by the satisfaction with bowel habits domain of the IBS-SSS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome-Severity Scale Scoring) score compared to the baseline. Minimum (best condition) : 0 to maximum (worse condition): 100

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of the IBS-related quality of life
secondary_outcome.description: Mesured by the IBS related quality of life domain of the IBS-SSS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome-Severity Scale Scoring) score compared to the baseline. Minimum (best condition) : 0 to maximum (worse condition): 100

secondary_outcome.measure: Global assessment of symptoms relief
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by the Subject's Global Assessment (SGA) of Relief, compared to the baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of Resolvin-D1 levels
secondary_outcome.description: Blood measurement of resolvin-D1 compared to the baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of CPRu (C Reactive Protein-ultrasensitive) levels
secondary_outcome.description: Blood measurement of C Reactive Protein ultrasensitive compared to the baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of the intestinal microbiota
secondary_outcome.description: Biological parameter : Fecal microbiota measured by 16S rRNA gene sequencing compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of the stool frequency
secondary_outcome.description: Patient-reported number of stools using an e-diary, compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of the stools consistency
secondary_outcome.description: Patient-reported stools consistency by the Bristol Stool Scale, using an e-diary, compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of the Quality of Life
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by Medical Outcomes Study Short-Form General Health Survey Short Form-12 compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Change of number of drugs consumption to alleviate the IBS-C symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Patient-reported drug (laxative, spasmolytics) consumption using an e-diary, compared to baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessing the relationship between resolvin D1 levels and symptoms severity mesured by IBS-SSS symptoms scores
secondary_outcome.description: Regression analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessing the relationship between baseline resolvin D1 levels and response to the probiotics supplementation measured by the responders rate (outcome 17)
secondary_outcome.description: Regression analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessing the responders rate
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients with a decrease in the weekly average of worst abdominal pain in the past 24 hours score (measured daily) of at least 30 percent compared with baseline weekly average and a stool Frequency Weekly Responder is defined as a patient who experiences an increase of at least one complete stool bowel movement per week from baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessing the relationship between baseline microbiota and response to the probiotics supplementation measured by the responders rate (outcome 17)
secondary_outcome.description: Regression analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessing the tolerance of the probiotics mixture
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse reactions analysis

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessing the global improvement
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by the patient global impression of improvement

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessing the satisfaction regarding the mixture of probiotics
secondary_outcome.description: Measured by a 5 points Likert scale 0 : worse satisfaction to 5 : better satisfaction

arm_group.description: Daily supplementation with a mixture of probiotics for 12 weeks

intervention.description: 12 weeks of daily supplementation with 1 g of probiotics mixture (4.10exp9 colony forming unit/g) containing: Bifidobacterium longum LA 101 Lactobacillus helveticus La 102 Lactococcus lactis LA 103 Streptococcus thermophilus LA 104
